text: When do we meet next?

text:
<@U018DRGAC5S> I’m free this Saturday like 10 or 11 AM (I have dinner plans). This is my last available weekend for ~2 months b/c I’ll be visiting family in another state in 2 weeks.

cc <@UHWC9PXBL> <@U0153L9R600> <@UFQQ3P867> <@UBN1G4C1J> and anyone else, *how do y’all feel about meeting up this Saturday late morning?*

elements.text:
I’m free this Saturday like 10 or 11 AM (I have dinner plans). This is my last available weekend for ~2 months b/c I’ll be visiting family in another state in 2 weeks.

cc
and anyone else,
how do y’all feel about meeting up this Saturday late morning?

text: it's striking that there is so little visualization packaging, afaik, for APL repls. Even a simple SVD or PCA to show intermediate operations seems pertinent, though I don't work with matrices at that level often

elements.text: it's striking that there is so little visualization packaging, afaik, for APL repls. Even a simple SVD or PCA to show intermediate operations seems pertinent, though I don't work with matrices at that level often

text: APL is great because it's concrete when you want it to be -- like Josh Horowitz's PANE, you can thread concrete data through (an identity matrix?) and see what happens

elements.text: APL is great because it's concrete when you want it to be -- like Josh Horowitz's PANE, you can thread concrete data through (an identity matrix?) and see what happens

text: the aesthetic motivation for all this ^ is performative matrices, i want to play the music of the matrices
